intro: Boehmeria macrostachya, commonly known as giant arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, often reaching several feet in height. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its fibrous stalks have been traditionally used for making rope and textiles in some regions.
